channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for OR
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for OR

item.title: Report X-2023121062
item.description:
Report X-2023121062

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-30T17:46:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-04
  • City: PORTLAND
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER DONNNED P.P.E. ENTERED TRAILER AND DISCOVERED LEAKER. USED DECISION TREE OF UNKNOWN, PH'D TESTED LIQUID WHICH WAS INDETERMINATIVE. PROCESSED CLEAN UP PER FLAMMABLE LIQUID RESPONSE SHEET. CONTAINERIZED ALL PACKAGES AND RETURNED TO PSC FOR FURTHER PROCESSING. UPON OPENING ONE OF THE PACKAGES, DISCOVERED AN AEROSOL CONTAINER. THERE WERE NO EXTERNAL MARKINGS. INFORMED RMP OF UNDECLARED. THEY TOOK PHOTOS AND CALLED HMSC WHO DETERMINED THAT IT WAS UNDECLARED. DAMAGE INSPECTION; LEAKED NON-REGULATED PRODUCT; NO LEAK TO AEROSOLS SUBMITTING THIS PACKAGE INTO THE ETT SYSTEM AND AWAITING INSTRUCTIONS ON PROPER DISPOSITION OF THIS PACKAGE.

item.title: Report X-2023121049
item.description:
Report X-2023121049

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-30T17:46:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-07
  • City: PORTLAND
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: DESIGNATED RESPONDER (DR) WAS CALLED TO CLEAN UP A SPILL OF A HAZARDOUS MATERIAL (HAZMAT) PACKAGE. DR RETRIEVED HAZMAT PACKAGE AND AFFECTED PACKAGES FROM THE TRAILER. DR BROUGHT HAZMAT PACKAGES BACK TO THE PACKAGE SERVICE CENTER (PSC) FOR PROCESSING. DR TRIAGED HAZMAT PACKAGE AND FOUND ONE CAP WAS LOOSE BUT THE OTHER TWO CAPS HAD BEEN TAPED BY THE SHIPPER.

item.title: Report X-2023121067
item.description:
Report X-2023121067

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-30T17:46:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-15
  • City: ALBANY
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: EMPLOYEE SUSPECTED THAT THE PACKAGE WAS LEAKING DUE A REUSED BOX WHICH HAD STAINS ON THE EXTERIOR. REWRAP; PACKAGE LEAKED ON BY ANOTHER PACKAGE; NO LEAK. ALL OF THE ITEMS IN THE PACKAGE ARE SUSPECTED OF BEING HAZARADOUS MATERIALS WHICH WERE NOT PROPERLY MARKED NOR SENT FROM AN AUTHORIZED HAZMAT SHIPPER. CONTACTED HAZMAT SUPPORT LINE, WAS TOLD TO COMPLETE UNDECLARED SHIPMENT PROCESS. PAINT RELATED MATERIAL PG 3 III UN1263.

item.title: Report X-2023120526
item.description:
Report X-2023120526

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-30T17:46:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-05
  • City: PORTLAND
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDED TO A LEAKING PACKAGE. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED TWO X 17 OUNCE AEROSOL CANS OF PURE SIMPLE CANOLA OIL. THE LID OF ONE CAN WAS NOT ENGAGED TO THE CAN AND WAS LEAKING FROM THE NOZZLE. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER PACKAGING. THE PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM CALIFORNIA USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER X63687, BOOKS INT'L C/O W.H. SADLIER, 22883 QUICKSILVER DR., STERLING VA 20166-2019.

Report I-2023120047

  • City: HARRISBURG
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FERRELL GAS
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 1
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Ferrellgas employee was driving on a rural two lane narrow road it was fog in the area and 20 feet of visibility. The bobtail got off the pavement into the gravel adn rolled over. Damage to the hose reel, front windshield, passenger side mirror, exhaust stack was bent. The Ferrellgas employee was injured, he sustained laceration to the left forearm. He was treated at a Urgent Care facility were he was treated and released, no lost time from work. There were no other vehicles involved and no other property damage.

item.title: Report X-2023110335
item.description:
Report X-2023110335

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-30T17:46:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-24
  • City: KLAMATH FALLS
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: BNSF RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: USE personnel opened the protective housing and inspected the valves and fittings. The liquid line valve closure plug was found to be leaking. The liquid line valve was in the closed position. USE personnel utilized hand tools to tighten the liquid line valve closure plug but found that it was already tool tight. The closure plug was then removed for further inspection. There were no leaks identified with the closure plug removed. USE personnel then applied thread tape to the closure plug, reinstalled, and tightened the closure plug to tool tight. USE personnel inspected the closure plug and found that there were no further leaks present. Upon completion, USE personnel closed and secured the protective housing with custody seal 249224. Integrity of the valve was inspected by placing a pressure gauge on the liquid line and monitoring over a period f a few hours. No LPG was found to be leaking past the closed valve.
